Berin,

> You always have to have somewhere to start.  Usually when you design
> such a component, you already have a usecase in mind.

The example you describe is what I'd call "testing the intended behaviour".
In my world the word "contract" implies something stronger, something more
formalized e.g. in invariants, pre- and postconditions as used in Design By
Contract. I fully agree that testing the intended behaviour (including
border conditions and error cases) contributes the overwhelming majority of
test cases.
As for me, however, I'd miss a few important ones if I did not look at the
implementation in order to discover the remaining 5 percent of tests.

Johannes
